page.title: 15Housing-Denny and Dunipace
page.content: Over the last few years Dunipace and Denny have become more densely populated and, in an effort to solve the{problem of housing}in the area, the local council became the first authority to experiment in the conversion of old property. In the late 60's and early 70's District councillors agreed to supply council homes for{overspill tennants}of Glasgow Corporation. Houses had to be built quickly. Flats, semi-detached and terraced type houses appeared. By the end of the 70's, however, people began to realise that renting their homes was expensive. The idea of{home {ownership}became more appealing. Building began again - more and more private homes appeared and were quickly bought up.{The population}now stands at 13,000 and is still growing and house building still increasing.
